Bruch module¶

class bruch.Bruch.Bruch(divisor_or_bruch, dividend=None)¶

Bases: object

The Bruch-Class represents a fraction with a integer-divisor and a integer-dividend. Nearly all operators can be used with this class.

__abs__()¶

Returns the absolute value of the fraction

Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__add__(other)¶

Adds a the fraction and a Bruch or a int

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to add
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__complex__()¶

Converts the fraction to a complex number

Returns:A complex number representing the fraction
__eq__(other)¶

Compares if the fraction is equal with a int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to compare
Returns:If it is equal
__float__()¶

Converts the fraction to a floating-point number

Returns:A floating-point number representing the fraction
__ge__(other)¶

Compares if the fraction is greater or equal with a int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to compare
Returns:If it is greater or equal
__gt__(other)¶

Compares if the fraction is greater than a int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to compare
Returns:If it is greater
__iadd__(other)¶

Adds a Bruch or a int to the fraction

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to add
Returns:The given instance
__imul__(other)¶

Multiplies the fraction with an int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to multiply
Returns:The given instance
__init__(divisor_or_bruch, dividend=None)¶

Creates a new Bruch-Object (fraction) containing a divisor and a dividend

Parameters:
  • divisor_or_bruch (Bruch A Bruch-Instance to copy) – The divisor or a Bruch-Instance to copy
  • dividend (None The divisor is represented as a full number (the dividend is 1)) – The dividend or None if the Bruch should represent a full number by the divisor
__int__()¶

Calculates the fraction to a floating-point number and then floors the value to an int

Returns:A int representing the fraction
__invert__()¶

Inverts the fraction by swapping the divisor and the dividend

Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__isub__(other)¶

Subtracts a Bruch or a int from the fraction

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to subtract
Returns:The given instance
__iter__()¶

Returns a iterator with divisor and dividend

Returns:A iterator with the divisor and dividend
__itruediv__(other)¶

Divides the fraction with an int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to divide
Returns:The given instance
__le__(other)¶

Compares if the fraction is lesser or equal with a int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to compare
Returns:If it is lesser or equal
__lt__(other)¶

Compares if the fraction is less than a int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to compare
Returns:If it is lesser
__mul__(other)¶

Multiplies the fraction with an int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to multiply
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__ne__(other)¶

Compares if the fraction is not equal with a int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to compare
Returns:If it is not equal
__neg__()¶

Negates the fraction

Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__pow__(power, modulo=None)¶

Raises the fraction by the given power

Parameters:power – The given power
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__radd__(other)¶

Adds a the fraction and a Bruch or a int

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to add
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__repr__()¶

Converts the fraction to a string

Returns:A string representing the fraction
__rmul__(other)¶

Multiplies the fraction with an int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to multiply
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__rsub__(other)¶

Subtracts the fraction from an int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value from which it should be subtracted from
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__rtruediv__(other)¶

Divides an int or a Bruch with the fraction

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to with the fraction should be divided
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__sub__(other)¶

Subtracts a Bruch or a int from the fraction

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to subtract
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
__truediv__(other)¶

Divides the fraction with an int or a Bruch

Parameters:other (Bruch) – value to divide
Returns:A new Bruch-Instance
